parameters.name: DBInstanceId
parameters.description: The ID of the DR instance.

parameters.name: DryRun
parameters.description:
Specifies whether to perform a dry run before the system creates the DR instance. Valid values:

*   **true**: performs a dry run but does not create the instance. The system checks the request parameters, request syntax, limits, and available resources.
*   **false** (default): performs a dry run and the actual request. If the request passes the dry run, the instance is directly created.

parameters.name: ReplicatorAccount
parameters.description: The account of the database that is used for data synchronization.

parameters.name: SourceAddress
parameters.description: The endpoint of the source ApsaraDB RDS for PostgreSQL instance or the IP address of the source ApsaraDB RDS for SQL Server instance.

parameters.name: SourceCategory
parameters.description:
The type of the source instance. Valid values:

*   **other**: other instances. **SQL Server instances are not supported.**
*   **aliyunRDS**: an ApsaraDB RDS instance.

parameters.name: SourceInstanceName
parameters.description: The name of the source instance. If you set **SourceCategory** to **aliyunRDS**, this parameter is required.

parameters.name: SourceInstanceRegionId
parameters.description: The region ID of the source instance. If you set **SourceCategory** to **aliyunRDS**, this parameter is required.

parameters.name: SourcePort
parameters.description: The port of the source instance.

parameters.name: TargetAddress
parameters.description: The IP address of the DR instance of the ApsaraDB RDS for SQL Server instance.

parameters.name: TaskId
parameters.description: The task ID of the successful dry run.

parameters.name: TaskName
parameters.description: The task name of the dry run. You can specify a custom task name. If you do not specify this parameter, ApsaraDB RDS automatically generates a task name.
